dict.string: (?x) (?<!\w) # Ensure word boundry (?> 0[xX] # Start literal (\h([\h_]*\h)?)? # Optional Number ( (?<=\h)\. # A number must exist on | \.(?=\h) # one side of the decimal | (?<=\h) # Decimal not required ) (\h([\h_]*\h)?)? # Optional Number [pP] # Exponent Indicator [+-]?(0|[1-9]([0-9_]*[0-9])?) # Signed Integer [fFdD]? # Float Type Suffix ) (?!\w) # Ensure word boundry

(?x) (?<!\w) # Ensure word boundry (?> ( (0|[1-9]([0-9_]*[0-9])?) # Leading digits (?=[eEfFdD.]) # Allow for numbers without . )? ( (?<=[0-9])(?=[eEfFdD]) # Allow for numbers without . | \. ) ( [0-9]([0-9_]*[0-9])? # Numbers after . )? ( [eE][+-]?(0|[1-9]([0-9_]*[0-9])?) # Exponent )? [fFdD]? # Float Type Suffix ) (?!\w) # Ensure word boundry
This is just to support <>'s with no actual type prefix
This is just to support <>'s with no actual type prefix
This is just to support <>'s with no actual type prefix
